node.title: Hurricanes win error-strewn game
node.description: The Hurricanes used their bench players to prevail over the Highlanders, 21-14, in round three of Super Rugby Pacific.

node.title: WNBA's Brittney Griner arrested in Russia on drug charges
node.description: She was arrested at a Moscow airport after a search of her luggage revealed vape cartridges.

node.title: Putin warns against creating no-fly zone over Ukraine
node.description: He said Russia would view "any move in this direction" as an intervention that "will pose a threat to our service members."

node.title: Ally Kostial murder: Inside her college life & evidence in the case
node.description: Ally Kostial loved attending the University of Mississippi. Her life was cut short on July 20, 2019, when she was shot dead by a fellow student at a desolate fishing camp about 30 miles from campus.

node.title: Florida Governor DeSantis defends "Don't Say Gay" bill
node.description: Florida's House has approved the bill, and it will appear before the Senate for a vote on Monday.

node.title: Pentagon says Russia's fired over 500 missiles as NATO warns of "more death"
node.description: "The days to come are likely to be worse," NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg said.

node.title: Super Rugby: Hurricanes 21, Highlanders 14
node.description: The Hurricanes beat the Highlanders tonight in round three of Super Rugby Pacific. Here's how it went down.

node.title: North Korea conducts ninth missile test of the year
node.description: North Korea fired at least one suspected ballistic missile toward the sea on Saturday, militaries in the region said, an apparent test just days before the South's presidential election.

node.title: Families reunite as borders reopen: 'It's pretty emotional being apart'
node.description: There was a true kiwi welcome at Auckland Airport this afternoon for the first group of New Zealanders returning home under the easing of Covid isolation rules.

node.title: Blues win thriller at Eden Park
node.description: The Blues are on the board in this season's Super Rugby Pacific after claiming a thrilling 24-22 come-from-behind win over the Chiefs at Eden Park.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 18,833 new community cases, 597 people in hospital, five deaths
node.description: The number of new community cases of Covid-19 has dropped below the 20,000 mark for the first time in several days, but the Health Ministry is still urging caution as it expects numbers to "jumpâ€¦

node.title: White Ferns pipped in thrilling World Cup opener
node.description: The White Ferns have lost their opening match of the Cricket World Cup in dramatic fashion.

node.title: Australian cricket great Shane Warne dies of suspected heart attack
node.description: Australian cricketer Shane Warne, one of the finest leg-spin bowlers of all time whose talent and personality transcended the sport, has died aged 52.

node.title: Fire crews battle large bush fire on Auckland's North Shore
node.description: Homes on Auckland's North Shore are no longer under threat from a large bush fire burning in the suburb of Okura.

node.title: Police continue to monitor protester gatherings
node.description: Protest activity around the country is being monitored by police, who are calling for evidence of criminal acts following Wednesday's violent clash at Parliament.

node.title: Russia blocks Facebook, says it restricts access to Russian media
node.description: Russia is blocking Facebook, the country's communications regulator said on Friday, in response to what it said were restrictions of access to Russian media on the platform.

node.title: Transmission Gully: NZTA slices red tape to open sooner
node.description: Waka Kotahi's move to speed up the opening of Transmission Gully is good news - as long as it does not compromise the quality of the new highway, the mayor of Porirua says.

node.title: Dozens killed in suicide bombing at mosque in Pakistan
node.description: A suicide bombing at a Shi'ite Muslim mosque during Friday prayers in the northwestern Pakistani city of Peshawar killed at least 56 people and injured nearly 200, police and hospital officials said.

node.title: Missing man Wayne Taylor last seen in Blenheim
node.description: Police are appealing for information about missing man Wayne Taylor after air and land searches failed to find him.

node.title: As Covid-19 hits wallets, households urged to seek financial advice
node.description: Financial mentors are urging people to seek advice as many households remain under pressure due to the impacts of Covid-19.

node.title: North Korea accused of firing suspected ballistic missile into sea
node.description: South Korea's presidential office said national security adviser Suh Hoon will preside over an emergency National Security Council meeting to discuss the launch.

node.title: New Air Force One delivery could be 17 months behind schedule
node.description: The new generation of the president's plane, Air Force One, was originally to be delivered by December 2024.

node.title: Three injured in Auckland CBD shooting
node.description: Three people were taken to hospital early this morning after a shooting in central Auckland.

node.title: Urgent U.N. meeting after attack on Ukraine nuclear power plant
node.description: U.S. Ambassador Linda Thomas-Greenfield urged Russia not to send its troops "into an unjust war â€” or on a suicide mission against a nuclear power plant."

node.title: Europe's biggest nuclear plant seized by Russian forces
node.description: Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant has been seized by the Russian military forces, according to regional authorities.

node.title: U.S. can't exempt migrant children from border deportation policy, judge rules
node.description: It's unclear if the administration will start to expel unaccompanied minors in light of Friday's court order.

node.title: New York City rolls back its COVID restrictions
node.description: Starting Monday, businesses will no longer be required to ask for vaccination cards, and masks will no longer be mandated in public schools for children ages 5 and older.

node.title: This week on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan," March 6, 2022
node.description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken, House Intelligence Committee Chair Adam Schiff and more appear on "Face the Nation with Margaret Brennan" on Sunday.

node.title: Florida wildfire prompts evacuations, local state of emergency
node.description: At least two homes have been burned by the fire and "multiple other structures" remain in danger, officials said.

node.title: 'Everyone's pitching in': Oz-based NZers respond to supermarket crisis
node.description: Countdown is bringing in Kiwi workers from Australia to run its chillers and turning office staff into forklift drivers to try and counter Omicron. Audio
